title: Brand Risk Strategist
content:
Who we are 
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies - from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups - use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone's reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
The Brand Risk team develops processes, solutions, product controls and detection systems to ensure merchants and platforms integrity, and protect Stripe and our users from compliance and reputational risks. We collaborate with partners across Risk, Engineering, Product and Compliance to design and implement best-in-class risk strategy, and play a critical role in Stripe’s risk management efforts. 
What you’ll do
We are looking for an experienced risk management professional to join the group and help drive brand risk mitigation efforts. You will leverage data and work with technical teams to build solutions, set short and long term approaches to areas such as terms of service enforcement, merchants’ classification and product misuse, and enable new products and experiences.
Responsibilities

Work in collaboration to design and drive brand risk strategy 
Build relationships and partner with stakeholders across Risk, Engineering, Ops and Data Science globally
Build expertise and deep know-how around Stripe’s policies, standards and requirements, as well as risk capabilities and tools
Leverage data and quantitative analysis to build optimal solutions, balancing risk and user experience

Who you are
We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

8+ years professional experience in a related field, such as Risk, Compliance, or Trust & Safety, within a fast paced, high growth company
8+ experience in a role with an emphasis on data analysis and/or a strong technical background. You have worked closely with engineers and data analysts to build systems, collect business requirements, and / or deliver insights
An analytical approach to decision-making. You are analytical, objective and skilled at using metrics to drive decisions, set goals, and evaluate performance
Experience communicating to all levels of management, including strong writing skills with experience writing strategy documents, one-page project updates, and whitepapers
Strong collaboration and relationship building skills, with an ability to influence stakeholders across organizations and borders
Demonstrated program management skills and a track record for building and scaling programs from the ground up

Preferred qualifications

Experience working in payments and / or tech industries
Experience in coding, ML algorithms / predictive modeling
PMP certification and/or Six Sigma certification

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
